author: ansgar.eth
content:
I will be filling in for Alex today:

ACDC #159 today 14:00 UTC (in ~4 hours)
Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1579
Zoom: Will share link shortly before the call

author: potuz
content: Is it my reading of the room or is it again a split along client devs and researchers on ACD?

author: ansgar.eth
content: you mean on ordering of shorter slot times vs ePBS / restructuring?

author: ansgar.eth
content: I am pretty neutral on this - I do think that on this topic in particular we have a bit of a stakeholder representation problem though. The people that really urgently want shorter slot times would not normally come onto acd.

author: tersec
content: that that's the researcher EIP, 7732 is the client dev EIP (approximately)

author: ansgar.eth
content:
I personally think EIP-7886 was just an attempt of bringing a specific alternative proposal onto paper, because among researchers there was the feeling that ePBS was a bit prematurely locking in the specifics.

I happen to also think ePBS is already quite good - possibly the best we can do, not certain though - so it's not clear that even we researchers don't want to ship it either

author: fradamt
content: I don't think that's really the case. For one thing, opinions on this have evolved a lot even since Berlin, as people spent more time thinking about the structure of the slot and its consequences, though this might not be legible at this point. There's probably at least 3 or 4 different opinions on this in the room I am sitting in right now, with 4 people ðŸ˜„

author: barnabemonnot
content: bit of a strawman tbh. generally feel there has been a healthy conversation, ordering of events is a fairly weak dividing line

author: ansgar.eth
content: haha <@755590043632140352> summoned all the researchers ðŸ™‚

author: barnabemonnot
content: all the ones who are in the same room atm at least :p

author: barnabemonnot
content: my view on 7886 is that it looked a bit more like what newer networks decoupling ordering from execution look like, with newer validity conditions. that would also apply if we moved to more opinionated MCP model. so in a way I feel 7886 may be more future-proof, but strictly in terms of pipelining 7732 achieves a lot as well (*if not more)

author: radekkapka
content: Thankfully not > 4 opinions or I would start getting nervous
